extendedIngredients.name: black walnuts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup chopped walnuts or pecans (my grandmother recommends black walnuts)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup chopped walnuts or pecans (my grandmother recommends black walnuts)
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped walnuts or pecans (my grandmother recommends black walnuts)

extendedIngredients.name: cinnamon
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons cinnamon (can sub 1 teaspoon with other spices such as allspice and nutmeg, go easy on the cloves though)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons cinnamon (can sub 1 teaspoon with other spices such as allspice and nutmeg, go easy on the cloves though)

extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 3 ounces cream cheese, softened to room temperature (Philadelphia cream cheese recommended)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 ounces cream cheese, softened to room temperature (Philadelphia cream cheese recommended)
extendedIngredients.originalName: cream cheese, softened to room temperature (Philadelphia cream cheese recommended)

extendedIngredients.name: lemon zest
extendedIngredients.original: 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest (optional, my addition)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest (optional, my addition)

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups (from about 3-4 regular sized zucchini) grated un-peeled zucchini (place grated zucchini in a sieve and press out some of the excess moisture before measuring)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups (from about 3-4 regular sized zucchini) grated un-peeled zucchini (place grated zucchini in a sieve and press out some of the excess moisture before measuring)

title: Grandma’s Zucchini Cake
instructions: 1 Preheat oven to 350°F.  Butter a 9x12 or 9x13 baking pan (I used a pyrex pan). 2 In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, and baking powder. Set aside.3 In a mixer, beat the 3 eggs on high speed until frothy.  Lower the speed and beat in the sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla, and lemon zest (if using). Stir in the flour mixture, a third at a time.  Stir in the zucchini and chopped nuts and/or raisins. 4 Pour mixture into a 9x12 or 9x13 baking pan.  Bake at 350°F for 40 to 45 minutes. (My grandmother's notes say you can also bake in an angel food pan for 1 hour.) Remove from oven and let cool completely before frosting.  (While the cake is cooling, let the frosting's cream cheese and butter sit at room temperature to soften.)5 To make the frosting, beat together the cream cheese and butter. Add the powdered sugar and beat until smooth.Frost the cake and serve. Store covered with aluminum foil.

steps.step: 1 Preheat oven to 350°F.  Butter a 9x12 or 9x13 baking pan (I used a pyrex pan). 2 In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, and baking powder. Set aside.3 In a mixer, beat the 3 eggs on high speed until frothy.  Lower the speed and beat in the sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla, and lemon zest (if using). Stir in the flour mixture, a third at a time.  Stir in the zucchini and chopped nuts and/or raisins. 4
Pour mixture into a 9x12 or 9x13 baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40 to 45 minutes. (My grandmother's notes say you can also bake in an angel food pan for 1 hour.)

Remove from oven and let cool completely before frosting.  (While the cake is cooling, let the frosting's cream cheese and butter sit at room temperature to soften.)5 To make the frosting, beat together the cream cheese and butter.
Add the powdered sugar and beat until smooth.Frost the cake and serve. Store covered with aluminum foil.
